result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek J Santiago

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derek J Santiago not in court, in custody. Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Derek J Santiago. Defendant's appearance waived. Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense received offer and requested plea hearing date. Plea hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derek J Santiago in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Derek J Santiago.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant has new case 22CF3729; defense requested status conference date. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain. Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derek J Santiago in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Derek J Santiago.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for motion hearing. Defense moves to dismiss counts 1 and 2 for lack of jurisdiction. Court hears arguments. For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTED the defense motion; COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3 are dismissed. State to file new criminal complaint and amended information. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36. Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derek J Santiago not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Derek J Santiago.  Attorney Michael Staskunas for Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense moves to dismiss counts 1 and 2 for lack of jurisdiction. Motion taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for further arguments.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Due to court being DOWN, court rescheduled the scheduling conference with parties via email correspondence. Scheduling conference rescheduled for September 6th, 2022 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Derek J Santiago in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont; both appear by video.  Defendant Derek J Santiago in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. 
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JLAV,; TBG,; CBT,;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Derek J Santiago in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Derek J Santiago in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derek J Santiago appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
